intro: Ageratina glyptophlebia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, blue or purple florets arranged in dense, mist-like clusters, giving it its common name. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Ageratina glyptophlebia is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
